title: The science of hearing - Douglas L. Oliver

multiple-choice.question: What is the primary function of the ear in the auditory system?

options.label: A
options.text: To receive and process sound information

options.label: B
options.text: To convert sound energy into neural signals

options.label: C
options.text: To transmit sound vibrations to the brain

options.label: D
options.text: To amplify sound waves

multiple-choice.question: Which of the following best describes the composition of the auditory system?

options.label: A
options.text: The ear and the brain, with the ear converting sound energy into neural signals and the brain receiving and processing the information those signals contain

options.label: B
options.text: The ear, the brain, and the auditory nerve, with each playing a separate role in sound processing

options.label: C
options.text: The eardrum, the tiny bones of the middle ear, and the cochlear fluid, which work together to convert sound waves into vibrations

options.label: D
options.text: The auditory nerve, the brainstem, and the auditory cortex, which process sound information

multiple-choice.question: How does the auditory system enable us to locate the source of a sound in space?

options.label: A
options.text: By comparing the time and intensity differences between sound waves reaching each ear

options.label: B
options.text: By analyzing the frequency of the sound

options.label: C
options.text: By converting sound waves into vibrations in the cochlear fluid

options.label: D
options.text: By using the brain's prior knowledge of sound sources

options.label: C
options.text: To amplify sound waves

options.label: D
options.text: To facilitate the movement of hair cells, which triggers a signal that travels to the brain

options.label: C

options.label: C
options.text: Simple, but not very accurate

title: Did the Amazons really exist? - Adrienne Mayor

options.label: B
options.text: The Greeks

options.label: C
options.text: The Amazons

options.label: D

options.label: C
options.text: Fishing and sailing

options.label: D
options.text: City-building and architecture
